joseph jacques cesaire joffre.gloss: French field marshal who commanded the Allied armies in France during World War II (1852-1931)

joseph john thomson.gloss: English physicist who experimented with the conduction of electricity through gases and who discovered the electron and determined its charge and mass (1856-1940)

joseph lincoln steffens.gloss: United States journalist whose exposes in 1906 started an era of muckraking journalism (1866-1936)

joseph lister.gloss: English surgeon who was the first to use antiseptics (1827-1912)

joseph louis barrow.gloss: United States prizefighter who was world heavyweight champion for 12 years (1914-1981)

joseph louis gay-lussac.gloss: French chemist and physicist who first isolated boron and who formulated the law describing the behavior of gases under constant pressure (1778-1850)

joseph m. jacquard.gloss: French inventor of the Jacquard loom that could automatically weave complicated patterns (1752-1834)

joseph mallord william turner.gloss: English landscape painter whose treatment of light and color influenced the French impressionists (1775-1851)

joseph marie jacquard.gloss: French inventor of the Jacquard loom that could automatically weave complicated patterns (1752-1834)

joseph mccarthy.gloss: United States politician who unscrupulously accused many citizens of being Communists (1908-1957)

joseph oliver.gloss: United States jazz musician who influenced the style of Louis Armstrong (1885-1938)

joseph paul dimaggio.gloss: United States professional baseball player noted for his batting ability (1914-1999)

joseph priestley.gloss: English chemist who isolated many gases and discovered oxygen (independently of Scheele) (1733-1804)

joseph pulitzer.gloss: United States newspaper publisher (born in Hungary) who established the Pulitzer prizes (1847-1911)

joseph raymond mccarthy.gloss: United States politician who unscrupulously accused many citizens of being Communists (1908-1957)

joseph rudyard kipling.gloss: English author of novels and poetry who was born in India (1865-1936)

joseph smith.gloss: religious leader who founded the Mormon Church in 1830 (1805-1844)

joseph stalin.gloss: Russian leader who succeeded Lenin as head of the Communist Party and created a totalitarian state by purging all opposition (1879-1953)

joseph warren stilwell.gloss: United States general who commanded the Allied forces in China and Burma and India during World War II (1883-1946)

josephus.gloss: Jewish general who led the revolt of the Jews against the Romans and then wrote a history of those events (37-100)

josh billings.gloss: United States humorist who wrote about rural life (1818-1885)

joshua.gloss: a book in the Old Testament describing how Joshua led the Israelites into Canaan (the Promised Land) after the death of Moses

joshua tree.gloss: a large branched arborescent yucca of southwestern United States having short leaves and clustered greenish white flowers

josiah quincy.gloss: American patriot who presented the colonists' grievances to the English king (1744-1775)

josiah spode.gloss: English potter who started a pottery famous for its bone china (1754-1827)

josip broz.gloss: Yugoslav statesman who led the resistance to German occupation during World War II and established a communist state after the war (1892-1980)

jostle.gloss: come into rough contact with while moving

jostling.gloss: the act of jostling (forcing your way by pushing)

josue.gloss: a book in the Old Testament describing how Joshua led the Israelites into Canaan (the Promised Land) after the death of Moses

jotun.gloss: (Norse mythology) one of a group of giants often in conflict with the Aesir

jotunn.gloss: (Norse mythology) one of a group of giants often in conflict with the Aesir

joule.gloss: a unit of electrical energy equal to the work done when a current of one ampere passes through a resistance of one ohm for one second
English physicist who established the mechanical theory of heat and discovered the first law of thermodynamics (1818-1889)

journal.gloss: a daily written record of (usually personal) experiences and observations
a ledger in which transactions have been recorded as they occurred

journalist.gloss: someone who keeps a diary or journal

journey cake.gloss: cornbread usually cooked pancake-style on a griddle (chiefly New England)

journeyer.gloss: a traveler going on a trip

journeying.gloss: the act of traveling from one place to another

journeyman.gloss: a skilled worker who practices some trade or handicraft

joust.gloss: a combat between two mounted knights tilting against each other with blunted lances

joviality.gloss: feeling jolly and jovial and full of good humor

jovian planet.gloss: any of the four outermost planets in the solar system

jowett.gloss: English classical scholar noted for his translations of Plato and Aristotle (1817-1893)

jowl.gloss: the jaw in vertebrates that is hinged to open the mouth

joyce.gloss: influential Irish writer noted for his many innovations (such as stream of consciousness writing) (1882-1941)

joystick.gloss: a lever used by a pilot to control the ailerons and elevators of an airplane

jockey.gloss: defeat someone through trickery or deceit

join forces.gloss: work together on a common enterprise of project

jollify.gloss: celebrate noisily, often indulging in drinking

jolly along.gloss: cause (somebody) to feel happier or more cheerful

jolly up.gloss: cause (somebody) to feel happier or more cheerful

josh.gloss: be silly or tease one another

joyride.gloss: ride in a car with no particular goal and just for the pleasure of it

jocose.gloss: characterized by jokes and good humor

jocund.gloss: full of or showing high-spirited merriment

joined.gloss: of or relating to two people who are married to each other
connected by a link, as railway cars or trailer trucks

joking.gloss: characterized by jokes and good humor

jolted.gloss: disturbed psychologically as if by a physical jolt or shock

jolting.gloss: causing or characterized by jolts and irregular movements

jolty.gloss: causing or characterized by jolts and irregular movements

jovial.gloss: full of or showing high-spirited merriment

jowly.gloss: having sagging folds of flesh beneath the chin or lower jaw

joyfully.gloss: in a joyous and gleeful manner

joyously.gloss: in a joyous and gleeful manner
